docs.text:
siddhi-execution-string


The 
siddhi-execution-string extension
 is an extension to 
Siddhi
 that 
provides basic string handling capabilities such as con-cat, length, convert to lowercase, replace all, etc.


Find some useful links below:




Source code


Releases


Issue tracker




Latest API Docs


Latest API Docs is 
4.0.2-SNAPSHOT
.


How to use


Using the extension in 
WSO2 Stream Processor






You can use this extension in the latest 
WSO2 Stream Processor
 that is a part of 
WSO2 Analytics
 offering, with editor, debugger and simulation support. 






This extension is shipped by default with WSO2 Stream Processor, if you wish to use an alternative version of this extension you can replace the component 
jar
 that can be found in the 
STREAM_PROCESSOR_HOME
/lib
 directory.






Using the extension as a 
java library




This extension can be added as a maven dependency along with other Siddhi dependencies to your project.




     
dependency

        
groupId
org.wso2.extension.siddhi.execution.string
/groupId

        
artifactId
siddhi-execution-string
/artifactId

        
version
x.x.x
/version

     
/dependency





Jenkins Build Status










Branch


Build Status










master












Features




hex
 
(
Function
)
Returns a hexadecimal string representation of str,
where each byte of each character in str is converted to two hexadecimal digits


coalesce
 
(
Function
)
Returns the value of the first of its input parameters that is not null


split
 
(
Function
)
Splits the source string by 
split.string
 and returns the substring specified via the 
group.number
.


replaceFirst
 
(
Function
)
Replaces the first substring of this string that matches the given expression, with the given replacement.


concat
 
(
Function
)
Returns a string that is the result of concatenating two or more string values.


reverse
 
(
Function
)
Returns the reverse ordered string of the input.


lower
 
(
Function
)
Converts the capital letters in the input string to the equivalent simple letters.


strcmp
 
(
Function
)
Compares two strings lexicographically.


length
 
(
Function
)
Returns the length of this string.


regexp
 
(
Function
)
Returns whether  this 'string' matches the given regular expression 'regex' or not.


upper
 
(
Function
)
Converts the simple letters in the input string to the equivalent capital/block letters.


repeat
 
(
Function
)
Repeats a string for a specified number of times.


equalsIgnoreCase
 
(
Function
)
Compares two strings lexicographically.


substr
 
(
Function
)
This returns a new string that is a substring of this string


trim
 
(
Function
)
Returns a copy of the string with leading and trailing whitespace omitted


charAt
 
(
Function
)
Returns the char value as a string value at the specified index.


unhex
 
(
Function
)
unhex(str)
 interprets each pair of characters in the argument as a hexadecimal number
and converts it to the byte represented by the number


contains
 
(
Function
)
This method returns 
true
 if the
input.string
 contains the specified sequence of char values in the 
search.string
. 


replaceAll
 
(
Function
)
Replaces each substring of this string that matches the given expression with the given replacement.




How to Contribute






Please report issues at 
GitHub Issue Tracker
.






Send your contributions as pull requests to 
master branch
. 






Contact us






Post your questions with the 
"Siddhi"
 tag in 
Stackoverflow
. 






Siddhi developers can be contacted via the mailing lists:


Developers List   : 
dev@wso2.org


Architecture List : 
architecture@wso2.org






Support






We are committed to ensuring support for this extension in production. Our unique approach ensures that all support leverages our open development methodology and is provided by the very same engineers who build the technology. 






For more details and to take advantage of this unique opportunity contact us via 
http://wso2.com/support/
.

Str


hex 
(Function)


Returns a hexadecimal string representation of str,
where each byte of each character in str is converted to two hexadecimal digits



Syntax


STRING
 hex(
STRING
 input.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string to find out the hexadecimal value.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


hex(
MySQL
) 




This will return the hexadecimal value of the input.string. In this case, out put will be "4d7953514c".



lower 
(Function)


Converts the capital letters in the input string to the equivalent simple letters.



Syntax


STRING
 lower(
STRING
 input.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string to convert in to the lower case(equivalent simple letters).

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


lower(
WSO2 cep 
)




This will convert the capital letters in the input.string to the equivalent simple letters. In this case, output will be "wso2 cep ".



split 
(Function)


Splits the source String by splitCharacter and return the string in the index given by returnedOutputPosition .



Syntax


STRING
 split(
STRING
 input.string, 
STRING
 split.string, 
INT
 group.number)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string that get replaced.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
split.string

        
String value used to split the input.string.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
group.number

        
Index of the splitted group

        

        
INT

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


split(
WSO2,ABM,NSFT
, 
,
, 0)




This will splits the given input.string by given split.string and returns the string in the index given by group.number. In this case, output will be "WSO2".



upper 
(Function)


Converts the simple letters in the input string to the equivalent capital/block letters.



Syntax


STRING
 upper(
STRING
 input.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string to convert in to the upper case(equivalent capital/block letters).

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


upper(
Hello World
)




This will convert the simple letters in the input.string to theequivalent capital letters. In this case, output will be "HELLO WORLD".



coalesce 
(Function)


Returns the value of the first of its input parameters that is not NULL



Syntax


INT|LONG|DOUBLE|FLOAT|STRING|BOOL|OBJECT
 coalesce(
INT|LONG|DOUBLE|FLOAT|STRING|BOOL|OBJECT
 argn)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
argn

        
It can have one or more input parameters in any data type.

        

        
INT
LONG
DOUBLE
FLOAT
STRING
BOOL
OBJECT

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


coalesce(null, 
BBB
, 
CCC
)




This will return the first input parameter that is not null. In this case, it will return "BBB"



length 
(Function)


Returns the length of this string.



Syntax


INT
 length(
STRING
 input.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string to find out length.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


length(
Hello World
)




This will output the length of the provided string. In this case, output will be 11 .



contains 
(Function)


This method returns true if and only if this string contains the specified sequence of char values.



Syntax


BOOL
 contains(
STRING
 input.string, 
STRING
 search.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string value.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
search.string

        
String value that going to search in input.string.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


contains(
21 products are produced by WSO2 currently
, 
WSO2
)




This will return a boolean value as the output. In this case, it will return "true". 



reverse 
(Function)


Returns the reverse ordered string of the input.



Syntax


STRING
 reverse(
STRING
 input.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string that get reversed.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


reverse(
Hello World
)




This will output a string value by reversing the incoming input.string. In this case, output will be "dlroW olleH".



replaceFirst 
(Function)


Replaces the first substring of this string that matches the given expression with the given replacement.



Syntax


STRING
 replaceFirst(
STRING
 input.string, 
STRING
 regex, 
STRING
 replacement.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string that get replaced.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
regex

        
Regular expression used to match the input string.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
replacement.string

        
replacement string that used.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


replaceFirst(
hello WSO2 A hello
,  'WSO2(.*)A', 'XXXX')




This will return a string after replacing the first substring by given replacement string. In this case, output will be "hello XXXX hello".



charAt 
(Function)


Returns the char value as a string value at the specified index.



Syntax


STRING
 charAt(
STRING
 input.value, 
INT
 index)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.value

        
The input string that used to find the character.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
index

        
The variable which specify the index.

        

        
INT

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


charAt(
WSO2
, 1)




This will output the character which exists at index 1. In this case, it will output 'S'.



replaceAll 
(Function)


Replaces each substring of this string that matches the given expression with the given replacement.



Syntax


STRING
 replaceAll(
STRING
 input.string, 
STRING
 regex, 
STRING
 replacement.string)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string that get replaced.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
regex

        
Regular expression used to match the input string.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
replacement.string

        
replacement string that used.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


replaceAll(
hello hi hello
,  'hello', 'test')




Returns a string after replacing the substrings of the input string with the replacement string. In this case, output will be "test hi test" .



strcmp 
(Function)


Compares two strings lexicographically.



Syntax


INT
 strcmp(
STRING
 arg1, 
STRING
 arg2)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
arg1

        
First input string argument.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
arg2

        
Second input string argument that going to be compared with first argument in lexicographically.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


strcmp(
AbCDefghiJ KLMN
, 'Hello')




This will compare two strings lexicographically and output an int value



equalsIgnoreCase 
(Function)


Compares two strings lexicographically.



Syntax


BOOL
 equalsIgnoreCase(
STRING
 arg1, 
STRING
 arg2)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
arg1

        
First input string argument.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
arg2

        
Second input string argument that going to be compared with first argument.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


equalsIgnoreCase(
WSO2
, 
wso2
)




This will return a boolean value as the output. In this case, it will return "true". 



concat 
(Function)


Returns a string that is the result of concatenating two or more string values.



Syntax


STRING
 concat(
STRING
 argn)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
argn

        
It can have two or more string type input parameters.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


concat(
D533
, 
8JU^
, 
XYZ
)




This will return a string value by concatenating the given arguments. In this case, it will return "D5338JU^XYZ" as the output



substr 
(Function)


Returns a new string that is a substring of this string



Syntax


STRING
 substr(
STRING
 input.string, 
INT
 begin.index, 
INT
 length, 
STRING
 regex, 
INT
 group.number)




Query Parameters



    

        
Name

        
Description

        
Default Value

        
Possible Types

        
Optional

        
Dynamic

    

    

        
input.string

        
Input string to be processed.

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
begin.index

        
Staring index to consider for the substring.

        

        
INT

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
length

        
Length of the substring.

        

        
INT

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
regex

        
Regular expression used to match the input string..

        

        
STRING

        
No

        
No

    

    

        
group.number

        
Regex group number

        

        
INT

        
No

        
No

    





Examples


Example 1


substr(
AbCDefghiJ KLMN
, 4)




This will output the substring based on the given begin.index. In this case, output will be "efghiJ KLMN".



Example 2


substr(
